Saccheri’s immortality was already assured. The name oi his friend Ceva is carried by Ceva’s Theorem.

Coolidge in his Non-Euclidem Geometry names Sac- cheri's the theorem: “In an isosceles birectangular· quadri- lateral a line through the middle point ol the side adjacent to both right angles, which is perpendicular to the line oi that side, will be perpendicular to the line of the opposite side and pass through its middle point. The other two angles ot the quadrilateral are mutually congruent.''
